p: The second element that might be necessary for a maternal-fetal infection is a placental tropism of the virus i.e. the virus will infect the placental cells and thus be transmitted to the fetal side. To date, no case of placental infection with SARS-CoV-2, has been reported in published study. In five publications, a total of 7 placentas delivered from COVID-19 patients were studied using RT-PCR ; SARS-CoV-2 was not found in any of them [ 16, 17, 12, 18, 19]. Furthermore, histopathological analysis of three placentas did not reveal any significant lesion [ 16].
